hpnicfMplsOam.name: hpnicfMplsOam
hpnicfMplsOam.description: This MIB contains objects to configure OAM module. The Operation, Administration and Maintenance (OAM) is an effective means for decreasing the cost of network maintenance. The MPLS OAM is used to administrate and maintain MPLS.

HpnicfMplsOAMDefectType.name: HpnicfMplsOAMDefectType
HpnicfMplsOAMDefectType.description: An indication of the OAM's defect type: 1: dServer, server layer defect; 2: dPeerMe, peer network maintenance entity defect; 3: dLOCV, Loss of Connectivity Verification defect; 4: dTTSIMismatch, Trail Termination Source Identifier Mismatch defect; 5: dTTSIMismerge, Trail Termination Source Identifier Mismerge defect; 6: dExcess, receiving excess rate of CV/FFD; 7: dUnknown, unknown defect in the MPLS network.. 8: rlsn down; 9: dLspDown; 10: MPLS OAM ME; 11: no defect.

HpnicfMplsOAMDetectFreq.name: HpnicfMplsOAMDetectFreq
HpnicfMplsOAMDetectFreq.description: An indication of the OAM's frequent type( ITU-T: Y.1711(0402) ): For CV: the frequency is static. The value is 1/s. For FFD: the frequency is set by user. The value can be 10ms, 20ms, 50ms, 100ms, 200ms, 500ms. Any other frequency is wrong. 1: 10ms; 2: 20ms; 3: 50ms; 4: 100ms; 5: 200ms; 6: 500ms; 7: 1000ms(only for cv).

hpnicfMplsOamCapability.name: hpnicfMplsOamCapability
hpnicfMplsOamCapability.description: Whether OAM is globally capable. false: incapable; true: capable; The default value is incapable.

hpnicfMplsOamTrapOpen.name: hpnicfMplsOamTrapOpen
hpnicfMplsOamTrapOpen.description: Whether OAM trap is globally enabled. false: disable; true: enable; The default value is disable.

hpnicfMplsOamIgrTable.name: hpnicfMplsOamIgrTable
hpnicfMplsOamIgrTable.description: This table specifies per-LSP MPLS OAM ingress capability and associated information, such as IgrLspName and IgrDetType.

hpnicfMplsOamIgrEntry.name: hpnicfMplsOamIgrEntry
hpnicfMplsOamIgrEntry.description: An entry in this table is created by an LSR for every LSP capable of supporting MPLS OAM at ingress.

hpnicfMplsOamIgrIndex.name: hpnicfMplsOamIgrIndex
hpnicfMplsOamIgrIndex.description: This is an unique index for an OAM ingress entry in the OAM table.

hpnicfMplsOamIgrLspName.name: hpnicfMplsOamIgrLspName
hpnicfMplsOamIgrLspName.description: The name of an LSP. It means the LSP name of the detected LSP.

hpnicfMplsOamIgrDetectType.name: hpnicfMplsOamIgrDetectType
hpnicfMplsOamIgrDetectType.description: There are two types of OAM packets, CV and FFD. The CV flow is generated at the source LSR of the LSP with a nominal frequency of 1/s and terminated at the sink LSR of the LSP. FFD provides failure detection option for an LSP independent of the CV based availability model and is not tied to the CV insertion rate. Insertion rates at 1/s or faster may also be used. The CV/FFD packet contains a network-unique identifier (TTSI) so that all types of defects can be detected. 1: CV; 2: FFD.

hpnicfMplsOamIgrDetectFreq.name: hpnicfMplsOamIgrDetectFreq
hpnicfMplsOamIgrDetectFreq.description: Indication of the OAM's frequent type.

hpnicfMplsOamIgrRevType.name: hpnicfMplsOamIgrRevType
hpnicfMplsOamIgrRevType.description: When an LSP is found to be in defect, the sink LSR of the LSP should send BDI to inform the source LSR of the LSP, the BDI is transferred through the reverse LSP. The type of reverse LSP can be private or shared. If private, then the reverse LSP can be used only by the oam ingress; If shared, the reverse LSP which is shared between many forward LSPs, whose source LSRs are the same and sink LSRs are the same. 1: private; 2: share.

hpnicfMplsOamIgrRevLspName.name: hpnicfMplsOamIgrRevLspName
hpnicfMplsOamIgrRevLspName.description: The object indicates the name of the reverse LSP.

hpnicfMplsOamIgrLspId.name: hpnicfMplsOamIgrLspId
hpnicfMplsOamIgrLspId.description: For ingress, the object indicates the lsp ID of the detected LSP.

hpnicfMplsOamIgrEnable.name: hpnicfMplsOamIgrEnable
hpnicfMplsOamIgrEnable.description: Whether one LSP is OAM enable. If disable, LSP is not monitored; If enable, CV/FFD is generated at the source LSR of the LSP and checked at the sink LSR of the LSP, and user can set other configuration. false: The OAM function is disabled on the ingress; true: The OAM function is enabled on the ingress.

hpnicfMplsOamIgrDefectType.name: hpnicfMplsOamIgrDefectType
hpnicfMplsOamIgrDefectType.description: Indication of the OAM's defect type.

hpnicfMplsOamIgrRowStatus.name: hpnicfMplsOamIgrRowStatus
hpnicfMplsOamIgrRowStatus.description: This object is responsible for managing the creation, deletion and modification of rows, which support active status and CreatAndGo, destroy operation. To create a new row, hpnicfMplsOamIgrLspName, hpnicfMplsOamIgrDetectType, hpnicfMplsOamIgrDetectFreq, hpnicfMplsOamIgrRevType, hpnicfMplsOamIgrRevLspName, and hpnicfMplsOamIgrLspId must be specified.

hpnicfMplsOamEgrTable.name: hpnicfMplsOamEgrTable
hpnicfMplsOamEgrTable.description: This table specifies per-LSP MPLS OAM capability and associated information, such as DetectType, DetectFrequency.

hpnicfMplsOamEgrEntry.name: hpnicfMplsOamEgrEntry
hpnicfMplsOamEgrEntry.description: An entry in this table is created by an LSR for every LSP capable of supporting MPLS OAM at egress.

hpnicfMplsOamEgrIndex.name: hpnicfMplsOamEgrIndex
hpnicfMplsOamEgrIndex.description: This is a unique index for an OAM egress entry in the OAM table.

hpnicfMplsOamEgrLspName.name: hpnicfMplsOamEgrLspName
hpnicfMplsOamEgrLspName.description: The object indicates the name of static LSP at egress.

hpnicfMplsOamEgrDetectType.name: hpnicfMplsOamEgrDetectType
hpnicfMplsOamEgrDetectType.description: There are two types of OAM packets, CV and FFD. The CV flow is generated at the source LSR of the LSP with a nominal frequency of 1/s and terminated at the sink LSR of the LSP. FFD provides failure detection option for an LSP independent of the CV based availability model and is not tied to the CV insertion rate. Insertion rates at 1/s or faster may also be used. The CV/FFD packet contains a network-unique identifier (TTSI) so that all types of defects can be detected. 1: CV; 2: FFD.

hpnicfMplsOamEgrDetectFreq.name: hpnicfMplsOamEgrDetectFreq
hpnicfMplsOamEgrDetectFreq.description: Indication of the OAM's frequent type.

hpnicfMplsOamEgrRevType.name: hpnicfMplsOamEgrRevType
hpnicfMplsOamEgrRevType.description: When an LSP is found to be in defect, the sink LSR of the LSP should send BDI to inform the source LSR of the LSP, the BDI is transferred through the reverse LSP. The type of reverse LSP can be private or shared. If private, then the reverse LSP can be used only when the only LSP in defect; If shared, the reverse LSP, which is shared between many forward LSPs that have the same source LSRs and sink LSRs. 1: private; 2: share.

hpnicfMplsOamEgrRevLspName.name: hpnicfMplsOamEgrRevLspName
hpnicfMplsOamEgrRevLspName.description: The object indicates the name of a reverse static-lsp.

hpnicfMplsOamEgrLsrId.name: hpnicfMplsOamEgrLsrId
hpnicfMplsOamEgrLsrId.description: The object indicates the Ingress LSR ID of the LSP.

hpnicfMplsOamEgrLspId.name: hpnicfMplsOamEgrLspId
hpnicfMplsOamEgrLspId.description: The object indicates the the Ingress session lsp ID of the detected static-LSP.

hpnicfMplsOamEgrEnable.name: hpnicfMplsOamEgrEnable
hpnicfMplsOamEgrEnable.description: Whether one LSP is enabled with OAM. If disable, LSP is not monitored; If enable, CV/FFD is generated at the source LSR of the LSP and checked at the sink LSR of the LSP, and user can set other configuration. false: The OAM function is disabled on the egress; true: The OAM function is enabled on the egress.

hpnicfMplsOamEgrDefectType.name: hpnicfMplsOamEgrDefectType
hpnicfMplsOamEgrDefectType.description: Indication of the OAM's defect type.

hpnicfMplsOamEgrRowStatus.name: hpnicfMplsOamEgrRowStatus
hpnicfMplsOamEgrRowStatus.description: This object is responsible for managing the creation, deletion and modification of rows, which support active status and CreatAndGo, destroy operation. To create a new row, hpnicfMplsOamEgrLspName, hpnicfMplsOamEgrDetectType, hpnicfMplsOamEgrDetectFreq, hpnicfMplsOamEgrRevType, hpnicfMplsOamEgrRevLspName, hpnicfMplsOamEgrLsrId and hpnicfMplsOamEgrLspId must be specified.

hpnicfMplsOamIgrLSPOutDefect.name: hpnicfMplsOamIgrLSPOutDefect
hpnicfMplsOamIgrLSPOutDefect.description: This notification is generated when the LSP is found out of the defect state at the LSP ingress.

hpnicfMplsOamIgrLSPInDefect.name: hpnicfMplsOamIgrLSPInDefect
hpnicfMplsOamIgrLSPInDefect.description: This notification is generated when the LSP is found in the defect state at the LSP ingress.

hpnicfMplsOamEgrLSPOutDefect.name: hpnicfMplsOamEgrLSPOutDefect
hpnicfMplsOamEgrLSPOutDefect.description: This notification is generated when the LSP is found out of the defect state at the LSP egress.

hpnicfMplsOamEgrLSPInDefect.name: hpnicfMplsOamEgrLSPInDefect
hpnicfMplsOamEgrLSPInDefect.description: This notification is generated when the LSP is found in the defect state at the LSP egress.
